fr.sii.ogham.assertion

Class OghamAssertions

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.assertion.OghamAssertions

  • public class OghamAssertions
extends Object
    Utility class that helps writing message assertions. For emails, you can write something like this: 
     
 assertThat(greenMail)
   .receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
       .message(0)
         .subject(is("Test"))
         .from()
           .address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr"))
           .and()
         .to()
           .address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr"))
         .and()
       .body()
 		   .contentAsString(is("body"))
         .contentType(startsWith("text/plain"))
         .and()
       .alternative(nullValue())
       .attachments(hasSize(1))
         .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
 		     .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
           .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
           .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
           .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
    For sms, you can write something like this: 
     
 assertThat(smppServer)
   .receivedMessages()
     .count(is(1))
       .message(0)
         .content(is("sms content"))
         .from()
           .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
           .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
 		     .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN))
           .and()
         .to()
           .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
           .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
 		     .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN));
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • assertThat

        public static ReceivedEmailsAssert assertThat(com.icegreen.greenmail.junit.GreenMailRule greenMail)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(greenMail).receivedMessages()
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .subject(is("Test"))
     .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
     .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
   .body()
      .contentAsString(is("body"))
      .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
   .alternative(nullValue())
   .attachments(hasSize(1))
   .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
      .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
      .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
      .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
      .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
        Parameters:
        greenMail - email server that stores received messages
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static EmailsAssert<Void> assertThat(javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage[] receivedEmails)
        Helper method to write assertions on mails using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(greenMail.getReceivedMessages())
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .subject(is("Test"))
     .from().address(hasItems("test.sender@sii.fr")).and()
     .to().address(hasItems("recipient@sii.fr")).and()
   .body()
      .contentAsString(is("body"))
      .contentType(startsWith("text/plain")).and()
   .alternative(nullValue())
   .attachments(hasSize(1))
   .attachment("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")
      .content(is(resource("/attachment/04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf")))
      .contentType(startsWith("application/pdf"))
      .filename(is("04-Java-OOP-Basics.pdf"))
      .disposition(is(ATTACHMENT_DISPOSITION));
        Parameters:
        receivedEmails - list of messages received by the email server
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static ReceivedSmsAssert assertThat(SmppServerRule<org.jsmpp.bean.SubmitSm> smsServer)
        Helper method to write assertions on sms using fluent API. For example: 
         
 assertThat(smppServer).receivedMessages()
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .content(is("sms content"))
     .from()
       .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
       .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.INTERNATIONAL))
       .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)).and()
     .to()
       .number(is(NATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))
       .typeOfNumber(is(TypeOfNumber.UNKNOWN))
       .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN));
        Parameters:
        smsServer - SMS server that stores received messages
        Returns:
        builder for fluent assertions on received messages

      • assertThat

        public static SmsListAssert<Void> assertThat(List<org.jsmpp.bean.SubmitSm> receivedSms)

 assertThat(smppServer.getReceivedMessages())
   .count(is(1))
   .message(0)
     .content(is("sms content"))

       .number(is(INTERNATIONAL_PHONE_NUMBER))

       .numberPlanIndicator(is(NumberingPlanIndicator.ISDN)).and()

      • usingContext

        public static <T> org.hamcrest.Matcher<T> usingContext(String reasonTemplate,
                                                       Context context,
                                                       org.hamcrest.Matcher<T> delegate)
        Ogham helper for keeping context information when using fluent assertions.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type used for the matcher
        Parameters:
        reasonTemplate - the template for the reason
        context - the evaluation context
        delegate - the matcher to decorate
        Returns:
        the matcher

      • isSimilarHtml

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<String> isSimilarHtml(String expectedHtml)
        Check if the HTML is similar to the expected. The HTML strings are parsed into Documents. Two documents are considered to be "similar" if they contain the same elements and attributes regardless of order.
        Parameters:
        expectedHtml - the expected HTML
        Returns:
        the matcher that will check if HTML is identical to expected HTML

      • isIdenticalHtml

        public static org.hamcrest.Matcher<String> isIdenticalHtml(String expectedHtml)
        Check if the HTML is identical to the expected. The HTML strings are parsed into Documents. Two documents are considered to be "identical" if they contain the same elements and attributes in the same order.
        Parameters:
        expectedHtml - the expected HTML
        Returns:
        the matcher that will check if HTML is identical to expected HTML

      • resourceAsString

        public static String resourceAsString(String path)
                               throws IOException
        Utility method that loads a file content from the classpath. UTF-8 charset is used.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the classpath resource
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - when resource can't be read or doesn't exist

      • resourceAsString

        public static String resourceAsString(String path,
                                      Charset charset)
                               throws IOException
        Utility method that loads a file content from the classpath.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the classpath resource
        charset - the charset used for reading the file
        Returns:
        the content of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - when resource can't be read or doesn't exist

      • resource

        public static byte[] resource(String path)
                       throws IOException
        Utility method that loads a file content from the classpath.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the classpath resource
        Returns:
        the content of the file as byte array
        Throws:
        IOException - when resource can't be read or doesn't exist
